passages.text: Today's Morning Meeting | Also Published Today | Key Changes | JPM Events | Upcoming Earnings
MENA Food Retail (Elena Jouronova, CFA)

We maintain our cautious stance on the Saudi food retail sector, as uninspiring revenue and earnings delivery in 2Q25 results have reinforced our concerns and prompted us to cut forecasts and PTs across our Saudi coverage. The growth of the online and discounter channels, acknowledged as a threat by Othaim during the 2Q25 results call, is prompting a reevaluation of store growth strategies among offline retailers while rising personnel and lease costs dampen profitability prospects. We continue to favor Spinneys in the MENA food retail space given its exposure to the UAE, where market dynamics are more favorable and where we see business model differentiation and strong competitive moat; its expansion into Kuwait presents additional upside potential. We continue to find valuations elevated for Alothaim & BinDawood (18- 22 P/Es for JPMc 3- 7% EPS CAGR in 2025- 27E) and believe that Spinneys offers a better risk- reward.
Asyad Shipping (Anna Antonova, CFA) (ASCO OM, N)
H1'25 tracks broadly in- line vs FY'25 IPO guidance & a better H2 is expected
South32 (Lyndon Fagan) (S32 AU, N)
FY25 First Take: earnings miss but EBITDA in line, FY26 costs as expected, FY27 volumes mixed
EMEA Spotlight (Sophie L Warris/bruna Haq)
Less is more - implications of China's "anti- involution" policy
EMEA Spotlight (Sophie L Warrick/Bruna Haq)
Liberation Implications Part II: Actionable views from our teams
Still Ow UAE v N Saudi (David Aserkoff, CFA/Inga Q Galeni)
What started as "Better growth/ same FX peg but much cheaper" is now "Better growth/ same FX peg at similar multiples"
Feedback from investor meetings suggests more incremental demand for the CEE region while bearishness in MENA persists
Feedback from investor meetings in KSA, UAE and London
Looking for alpha in a volatile world: Prefer ADCB, ADIB, FAB, SNB and SAB
The Polish Compromise (Part 2): Investor feedback and three key debates on PEO- PZU merger
In the right place at the right time... significant optionality in play; Remain OW
New project up and running, staying OW despite tough industry backdrop, China is key
| Arabian Drilling (Jarryd R Thomas) (ARABIAND AB, UW, PT SRIs73.00)
When the going gets tough - downgrade to Underweight, TP SAR 73
Uranium Deep Dive - Key Takeaways
Reiterate OW with high conviction. Ample drivers for re-rating ahead
Slower for now, stronger later; feedback from Türkiye trip
Upgrade to Overweight as the UK motor finance overhang is lifted
Core thesis remains in play despite weak Q2 print
